channel.title: US turned blind eye to torture
channel.description:
Leaked documents on Iraq war contain thousands of allegations of abuse, but a Pentagon order told troops to ignore them.
See this video: http://english.aljazeera.net/secretiraqfiles/2010/10/20101022161828428516.html
This is how America* spreads freedom and democracy:
step 1: Bomb the fuck out of the country step 2: Convince the people that you only bombed them to bring them peace step 3: Set up a corrupt government which is exponentially worse than the previous one
Mitb, this is the face of the American imposed Iraqi government. This is what the coalition is losing thousands of men to defend.
*It is not only America defending this government, rather it includes an array of US-cock-sucking countries: 1. Albania 2. Armenia 3. Austrailia 4. Azerbaijan 5. Bosnia and Herzegovina 6. Bulgaria 7. Czech Republic 8. Denmark 9. El Salvador 10. Estonia 11. Georgia 12. Japan 13. Kazakhstan 14. South Korea 15. Latvia(Kaitnieks loooool) 16. Lithuania 17. Macedonia 18. Moldova 19. Mongolia 20. Poland 21. Romania 22. Singapore 23. Slovakia 24. Ukraine 25. United Kingdom 26. Tonga 27. Hungary 28. Iceland 29. Italy 30. Netherlands 31. Portugal 32. Slovenia 33. Turkey
If your country is listed there, I hope you enjoy paying tax to supply the tools which the Iraqi police/army use to torture people.
Edit: I should mention that all those countries except the USA have retreated from Iraq.

America’s Positive > Negative?.. That is all.
[/quote]I fail to see much positive at all, enlighten me please
[/quote]Oh shit, I forgot the melting pot, liberty, and those other cool ideas do not exist.
[/quote]m8, go back to the schoolbench thanks. Liberty was not an idea “created” by the US.[/quote]shit, must reevaluate delivery.

item.source: US turned blind eye to torture

item.title: US turned blind eye to torture
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:17, topic:365555”][quote author=Frell link=topic=461757.msg3378335#msg3378335 date=1287818665]
Im tired of this shit. War never changes, it wont change, it cant change. We torture them, they torture us. Its been like that for thousands of years and just because someone brings it up again makes it a big deal? The tortures are very horrible, more horrible than usual. Shows you how much hostility Iraq has towards the suspects, they clearly don’t want us out if we’re helping them fight what they’ve been dealing with for years. As for the country, its made no progression in this world. Iraq was practically dirt until they found oil, and the money still wasnt used to fix it. Its a horrible place to live, the 2003 invasion was supposed to change this and give the country a chance for democracy and self progression. Instead the inhabitants resist and it stirs up the factions and literally makes the place hell. Believe me, we want out. But theres this thing that America has were they rebuild the damage they’ve done, in this case, the result of Saddam’s regime resistance at the start of the invasion. We wouldnt be over there so long if we thought the country didnt have a chance. Any time a country has a chance to be free, we step in. But when the people are so brainwashed and scared that they cant rap their heads around what a free world is like, or how to live under a democracy it wont work, and it cant work. Its a lost cause. That is what Vietnam, Korea, and Iraq are all about. Along with that, it and (mostly) Iran were such a threat to neighboring countries we had to go and sort it out. While the rest of the coalition pussied out we had to stay and do the dirty work. So why complain about it?

Iraq in Saddam’s period was exponentially safer than it is now.

For the people in Iraq. Not all the oil he was trying to steal or the countries he threatened with nukes. What about the money he funded to terrorists? What about the torturings he and his sons did in his basement?

They use other techniques too. Here’s a video which was supposedly captured by alqaeda featuring a CIA interrogator torturing an innocent Afghani. There’s no way of verifying this but I think it’s obvious from viewing the video that it is genuine.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EKm9Vf6lkrU

It starts with Arabic dialog, skip to 0:35 for the interrogation.

Its so easy to pull this shit off, take a video of a suspect being tortured or a house being raided, throw the word innocent or civilian in there and you got a bunch of people fired up with a false fuse. Lets take a video of a muslim in new york pulling a gun out in public and getting tackled by the police. But lets cut out the gun drawing part and add a title like "US shows constant hostility and hate towards muslims in America - Video of an innocent being tackled and beaten in the street.

Criminals should have their crimes exposed, regardless if it endangers them.

Our military is endangered dealing with the constant crime and anarchy in the middle east, i thank your concern.
[/quote]
America shouldn’t be there to begin with its not our responsibility to free other countries. We should just deal with our own issues like our horrid economy and stop worrying about shit that never was and never will be our business.[/quote]
honestly, basically the US plans to be friendly to other countires, help them out so they repay them, chances are, nothing will change, either nothing will change, or they will get benefit out of it, but they will continue to see us as the way they always see us : stupid and ignorant
no matter how much we help them, they wont change their thoughts of us.
If we dont help them, all of them will eventually weaken too much, and the US would just get stronger not helping any countries out, building economy, less homeless = more taxes = stronger army, so we could take anyone on, i mean i dont see any of those greedy bastards helping anyone out… this is just my opinion, no i am no american.

someone is going to post something of another country helping out another country in need right now… even though thats probably the only thing happening.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:71, topic:365555”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=461757.msg3379583#msg3379583 date=1287921816]
I hate people like mwiebelhaus who spouts about liberalism, when in fact most of the liberal view are pure shit, it only has a very few good points. I take it as an insult whenever someone calls me a liberal, because i’m sure as hell not one of them.

American politics, either you are Liberal or Conservative
[/quote]
Id like to bring this up again. I think you’re confused about the parties. You dont choose to be a certain one, your beliefs will categorize you.

Take this survey and it will tell you what you are: http://www.nolanchart.com/survey.php

In the US its impossible to rule as a communist, because we arent built on communism so anything they will try to do wont get through our government, its wasted effort.[/quote]

That’s a neat little test, it seems we are fairly close to each other too:

But it is entirely focused on the USA, so I’m not sure it would be really relevant to anyone else, since they might not understand all of the issues presented.
